result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Drozda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.   The costs are added to defendant's current payment plan with the clerk of court's office and payments shall begin 30 days after release from custody.  Defendant shall keep the clerk's office informed of his release date.
Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim due within 60 days of sentencing and shall be preapproved by the victim witness coordinator.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in court with attorney Shari L Post.  Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No factual inaccuracies in the PSI.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Agreement put into the record.  Argument by Attorney Post.
